Rpackage

Source: R/Data.R
Data.Rd

The dataset contains Disability-Adjusted Life Years (DALYs) per 100,000 population for five major healthcare-associated infections — HAP, SSI, BSI, UTI, and CDI — across two surveillance studies: the German PPS and the ECDC PPS (EU/EEA).

Usage

Data

Format

A tibble with 20 rows and 5 variables:

group

Surveillance study — either "German PPS" or "ECDC PPS".

category

Infection type: HAP (Hospital-acquired pneumonia), SSI (Surgical site infection), BSI (Bloodstream infection), UTI (Urinary tract infection), CDI (Clostridioides difficile infection).

component

DALY component — "YLD" (Years Lived with Disability) or "YLL" (Years of Life Lost).

value

DALYs per 100,000 population for that infection and component.

se

Standard error for the total DALY estimate (used for uncertainty/error bars).

Source

Adapted from Zacher, B. et al. (2019), Estimates of the burden of healthcare-associated infections in Germany based on a population survey, PLOS Medicine. https://cwd.numbat.space/assignments/assignment-2-papers/Zacher2019.pdf

Details

Each infection’s burden is represented by two DALY components:

  • YLD (Years Lived with Disability) – measures morbidity or time lived in less than full health.

  • YLL (Years of Life Lost) – measures premature mortality due to infection.

The dataset supports analysis and visualisation of infection burden across surveillance regions, including uncertainty through standard error values.

Examples

data("Data", package = "Rpackage")
head(Data)
#> # A tibble: 6 × 5
#>   group      category component value    se
#>   <chr>      <fct>    <fct>     <dbl> <dbl>
#> 1 German PPS HAP      YLD          35    30
#> 2 German PPS HAP      YLL          50    30
#> 3 German PPS SSI      YLD           8     6
#> 4 German PPS SSI      YLL          30     6
#> 5 German PPS BSI      YLD          12    28
#> 6 German PPS BSI      YLL          59    28
